result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevion Dacarey Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation. Defendant must be 100% compliant with all rules and regulations.

miscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with the victim. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the co-actors.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Cts 4 & 5: 943.20(1)(a)-Theft-Movable Property. No contact with the victim or co- defendants (person, property, residence or family). No electronic or social media contact.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780), exceptions are going to school, court and meeting w/his Atty. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Trevion Dacarey Sims in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for another status date as he has not been able to get all discovery and negotiate with the State. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Defense asks that bond be modified to remove GPS or in the alternative, an allowance for employment search and subsequent employment. The State does not object to allowing deft to have time for interviews if they are scheduled and subsequent employment but the State objects to blanket job search.

BTC: bond may be modified to allow for scheduled interviews and subsequent employment. ZCI must be notified in advance of all appointments  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
